means: 没有充分地陈述实情(understate的过去式和过去分词)
轻描淡写的陈述，不完全的陈述

sentence.Network_en: The dress reflects our signature style of understated elegance with a strong feeling of individuality.
sentence.Network_cn: 这条裙子体现了我们所追求的低调优雅又有强烈个性感的独特风格。

sentence.Network_en: I have always liked understated clothes — simple shapes which take a lot of hard work to get right.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一直喜欢不太惹眼的衣服——简单的款式需要下大工夫才能弄得恰到好处。

sentence.Network_en: I have always liked understated clothes.
sentence.Network_cn: 我一向喜欢简朴的衣服。

entry.tran: 朴素的；低调的；不夸张的；不惹眼的
entry.def: If you describe a style, colour, or effect as understated, you mean that it is not obvious.

example.ex: I have always liked understated clothes — simple shapes which take a lot of hard work to get right.
example.tran: 我一直喜欢不太惹眼的衣服——简单的款式需要下大工夫才能弄得恰到好处。
